ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course. It definitely makes you read a paper differently, and I can already see the difference in how I approach writing a manuscript. It surprised me how much time I needed to put into reading the papers, and how much more I probably needed in order to see everything the instructors wanted us to see!
I believe we have to take the course no matter what. It is really good chance to know the strength and weakness of your fellow classmates as well.
The skills I learned in this course will be invaluable for reading/understanding papers in the future.

This is a must-have class if one wants to learn how to effectively read and communicate science. I would recommend this class to another student because it is a very useful class in anyone's future research career.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: See above; this course was very helpful in learning both how to structure a research project and how to present the results from it. A lot of the specific details from the papers will probably not be used in my future research, but I don't think that really matters here.
It shows me the logical and discrete way of molecular biology research, which is crucial to start a research career.
